name: dark-caracal

procedures: T1005::[Dark Caracal] collected complete contents of the 'Pictures' folder from compromised Windows systems.
T1027.002::[Dark Caracal] has used UPX to pack [Bandook].
T1027::[Dark Caracal] has obfuscated strings in [Bandook] by base64 encoding, and then encrypting them.
T1059.003::[Dark Caracal] has used macros in Word documents that would download a second stage if executed.
T1071.001::[Dark Caracal]'s version of [Bandook] communicates with their server over a TCP port using HTTP payloads Base64 encoded and suffixed with the string “&&&”.
T1083::[Dark Caracal] collected file listings of all default Windows directories.
T1113::[Dark Caracal] took screenshots using their Windows malware.
T1189::[Dark Caracal] leveraged a watering hole to serve up malicious code.
T1204.002::[Dark Caracal] makes their malware look like Flash Player, Office, or PDF documents in order to entice a user to click on it.
T1218.001::[Dark Caracal] leveraged a compiled HTML file that contained a command to download and run an executable.
T1547.001::[Dark Caracal]'s version of [Bandook] adds a registry key to HKEY_USERS\Software\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Run for persistence.
T1566.003::[Dark Caracal] spearphished victims via Facebook and Whatsapp.

description: [Dark Caracal](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0070) is threat group that has been attributed to the Lebanese General Directorate of General Security (GDGS) and has operated since at least 2012. (Citation: Lookout Dark Caracal Jan 2018)
